bioghist.p: Pioneer aircraft designer who worked for Curtiss Aeroplane & Motor Co. and Curtiss-Wright Corp. from 1918-1946. Co-designed the P-40 and C-46 transport.

scopecontent.p: Technical papers, newspaper clippings, articles, photographs and correspondence from and about the Curtiss-Wright Corp. and its personnel. Includes materials on several Curtiss-Wright and Curtiss Aeroplane & Motor Co. aircraft including the B-2 Bomber, the NC-4, the June Bug and the Curtiss Racers. The technical papers contain information on the forming of various metals into airplane parts, procedures on methods of welding and published procedural manuals from the Curtiss-Wright Corp. chiefly from 1940 to 1945. Other materials collected by A.G. Butler are patents awarded to him, and materials on aircraft, aviation museums, the Aero Club of Buffalo and the OX-5 Aviation Pioneers.

arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: I. Arthur G. Butler, personal materials and manuscripts. II. Clippings and articles on Curtiss employees as well as other aviation persons. III. Products and related craft of Curtiss Aeroplane & Motor Co. and Curtiss-Wright Corp. IV. Histories and photographs of Curtiss Aeroplane & Motor Co. and Curtiss- Wright Corp. V. Curtiss-Wright technical files of A.G. Butler. VI. Other transportation craft. VII. Aviation museums. VIII. Aviation organizations. IX. Assorted materials pertaining to general aviation. Arranged alphabetically within each series, except series I, IV, and V, which are in the order Mr. Butler had them.

userestrict.p: Written permission required to reproduce and/or publish. Information on use and fees may be obtained from the Director of Library and Archives.
